TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CustomErrorCollection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection

Docs.summary: Represents a collection of objects. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The CustomErrorCollection type allows access to the `error` elements of the `customErrors` section element collection.
It belongs to a group that includes the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError>, <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsMode>, and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection>.
## Examples This example demonstrates how to specify values declaratively for the `error` elements of the `customErrors` section, which can also be accessed as elements of the CustomErrorCollection collection.
The following configuration file example shows how to specify values declaratively for the `error` elements.
``` <customErrors mode="RemoteOnly" defaultRedirect="customerror.htm"> <error statusCode="404" redirect="customerror404.htm"/> </customErrors> ```
The following code example demonstrates how to use the CustomErrorCollection class.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.configurati_79_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.configurati_79_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The CustomErrorCollection constructor is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET configuration system. You obtain an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> class by using the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection.Errors%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Add(class System.Web.Configuration.CustomError customError) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to add already exists in the collection or the collection is read only.
Docs.summary: Adds a object to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Before adding a custom error to the collection, you must create a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError> error object and initialize the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError.Redirect%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError.StatusCode%2A> properties.
## Examples The following code example adds a <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError> object to the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> collection.
Refer to the code example in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> class topic to learn how to get the collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/767365fb-6715-4b65-9d9c-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/767365fb-6715-4b65-9d9c-_1.cs)]

Docs.summary: Returns an array of the keys for all of the configuration elements contained in this .
Docs.value: An array containing the keys for all of the objects contained in this .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all objects from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The result of updating the configuration file after calling the Clear method is dependent upon the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> chosen. To update the configuration file, you use one of these two overloads: <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> and <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A>.
> [!NOTE] > Calling <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A> is equivalent to calling <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A>.
If you use the <xref:System.Configuration.Configuration.Save%2A>.method, the following conditions apply.
- If you pass a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> or <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> parameter value, then a `clear` element is inserted into the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level.
- If you pass the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode> parameter value, a series of `remove` elements are added to the [clientTarget Element (ASP.NET Settings Schema)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/17a0fa6e-a065-49cc-b900-ef73eda6a922) of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level. Each removes all references to an `add` element defined in a parent configuration file at a higher level in the hierarchy. When you use <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationSaveMode>, there is one additional property on the collection that affects what gets serialized to the configuration file: <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A>, which is `false` by default. The following conditions apply.
- If the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> set to `true`, `clear` element is inserted into the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level. This removes all references to the `add` elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
- If the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.EmitClear%2A> flag is set to `false`, the `clear` element is removed from the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level, if it exists.
The Clear method actually deletes the `add` elements defined in the `clientTarget` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level. It also removes all references to the add elements defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
> [!NOTE] > The `add` elements are not deleted from the `clientTarget` section of the parent configuration files.
## Examples The following code example removes all the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError> objects from the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> collection. Refer to the code example in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> class topic to learn how to get the collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#6](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_69_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#6](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_69_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string statusCode) cil managed

Docs.param: The HTTP status code associated with the custom error.
Docs.summary: Removes a object from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Remove method inserts a `remove` element into the `customErrors` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level. This removes the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher levels in the hierarchy.
> [!NOTE] > The `add` elements are not deleted from the parent configuration files. The `remove` element merely deactivates them. However, the Remove method does actually delete them at the current hierarchy level.
## Examples The following code example shows how to remove the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError> object with the specified status code. Refer to the code example in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> class topic to learn how to get the collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#7](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_17_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#7](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_17_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The collection index of the object to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes a object at the specified index location from the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The RemoveAt method inserts a `remove` element into the `customErrors` section of the configuration file at the current hierarchy level. This is to remove the reference to the `add` element defined in the parent configuration files at higher-level in the hierarchy.
**Note** The `add` elements are not deleted from the parent configuration files. They are merely deactivated. However, the RemoveAt method does actually delete them at the current hierarchy level.
## Examples The following code example shows how to remove the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomError> object at the specified index. Refer to the code example in the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorCollection> class topic to learn how to get the collection.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#8](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.configurati_63_1.vb)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Configuration.CustomErrorsSection#8](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.configurati_63_1.cs)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks This specified error replaces the current configuration error element.
